briefdescription.para: Shortcut to AstarPath.active.
Should graph-data be cached.

detaileddescription.para: Caching the startup means saving the whole graphs, not only the settings to an internal array (data_cachedStartup) which can be loaded faster than scanning all graphs at startup. This is setup from the editor.

briefdescription.para: Backup data if deserialization failed.
Serialized data for cached startup.
All graphs this instance holds.

detaileddescription.para: This will be filled only after deserialization has completed

briefdescription.para: All supported graph types.

detaileddescription.para: Populated through reflection search

briefdescription.para: Shortcut to the first GridGraph.

detaileddescription.para: Updated at scanning time. This is the only reference to GridGraph in the core pathfinding scripts

briefdescription.para: Has the data been reverted by an undo operation.

detaileddescription.para: Used by the editor's undo logic to check if the AstarData has been reverted by an undo operation and should be deserialized

briefdescription.para: Shortcut to the first NavMeshGraph.

detaileddescription.para: Updated at scanning time. This is the only reference to NavMeshGraph in the core pathfinding scripts

briefdescription.para: Holds temporary path data for pathfinders.

detaileddescription.para:
One array for every thread. Every array is itself an array with a number of NodeRun object of which there is one per node of. These objects holds the temporary path data, such as the G and H scores and the parent node. This is separate from the static path data, e.g connections between nodes.
CreateNodeRuns

briefdescription.para: Shortcut to the first PointGraph.

detaileddescription.para: Updated at scanning time. This is the only reference to PointGraph in the core pathfinding scripts

briefdescription.para: Links placed by the user in the scene view.
Serialized data for all graphs and settings.
Adds a graph of type type to the graphs array.
Adds a graph of type type to the graphs array.
Adds the specified graph to the graphs array.
Loads the graphs from memory, will load cached graphs if any exists.
Creates a new instance of a graph of type type.

detaileddescription.para:
If no matching graph type was found, an error is logged and null is returned
The created graph
CreateGraph(System.Type)

briefdescription.para: Creates a new graph instance of type type.
Creates the structure for holding temporary path data.

detaileddescription.para:
The data is for example the G, H and F scores and the search tree. The number of nodeRuns must be no less than the number of nodes contained in all graphs. So after adding nodes, this MUST be called. Ideally, I would code an update function which reuses most of the previous ones instead of recreating it every time.
numParallel
Number of parallel threads which will use the data.
nodeRuns
AstarPath.UpdatePathThreadInfoNodes

briefdescription.para: Deserializes graphs from data.
Deserializes graphs from the specified byte array.

detaileddescription.para: If an error ocurred, it will try to deserialize using the old deserializer. A warning will be logged if all deserializers failed.

briefdescription.para: Deserializes graphs from the specified byte array additively.

detaileddescription.para: If an error ocurred, it will try to deserialize using the old deserializer. A warning will be logged if all deserializers failed. This function will add loaded graphs to the current ones

briefdescription.para: Deserializes common info.

detaileddescription.para: Common info is what is shared between the editor serialization and the runtime serializer. This is mostly everything except the graph inspectors which serialize some extra data in the editor

briefdescription.para: Deserializes common info additively Common info is what is shared between the editor serialization and the runtime serializer.

detaileddescription.para: This is mostly everything except the graph inspectors which serialize some extra data in the editor

briefdescription.para: Returns the first graph of type type found in the graphs array.

detaileddescription.para: Returns null if none was found

briefdescription.para: Loop through this function to get all graphs of type 'type'.
Find all graph types supported in this build.

detaileddescription.para: Using reflection, the assembly is searched for types which inherit from NavGraph.

briefdescription.para: Gets the index of the NavGraph in the graphs array.

simplesect.para: A System.Type which matches the specified type string. If no mathing graph type was found, null is returned

briefdescription.para: Returns the node at graphs[graphIndex].nodes[nodeIndex].

detaileddescription.para: All kinds of error checking is done to make sure no exceptions are thrown.

briefdescription.para: Returns the node at graphs[graphIndex].nodes[nodeIndex].

detaileddescription.para: The graphIndex refers to the specified graphs array. All kinds of error checking is done to make sure no exceptions are thrown

briefdescription.para: All graphs which implements the UpdateableGraph interface.
All graphs which implements the UpdateableGraph interface.
Tries to find a graph with the specified GUID in the graphs array.

detaileddescription.para:
Returns null if none is found
GuidToIndex

briefdescription.para: Tries to find a graph with the specified GUID in the graphs array.

detaileddescription.para:
If a graph is found it returns its index, otherwise it returns -1
GuidToGraph

briefdescription.para: Removes the specified graph from the graphs array and Destroys it in a safe manner.
Serializes all graphs settings to a byte array.
Main serializer function.
Main serializer function.

detaileddescription.para: Serializes all graphs to a byte array A similar function exists in the AstarEditor.cs script to save additional info

briefdescription.para: Serializes common info to the serializer.

detaileddescription.para: Common info is what is shared between the editor serialization and the runtime serializer. This is mostly everything except the graph inspectors which serialize some extra data in the editor

briefdescription.para: Updates shortcuts to the first graph of different types.

detaileddescription.para: Hard coding references to some graph types is not really a good thing imo. I want to keep it dynamic and flexible. But these references ease the use of the system, so I decided to keep them. It is the only reference to specific graph types in the pathfinding core.

briefdescription.para: Returns the graph which contains the specified node.

detaileddescription.para:
The graph must be in the graphs array.
Returns the graph which contains the node. Null if the graph wasn't found

briefdescription.para: Stores the navigation graphs for the A* Pathfinding System.

detaileddescription.para: An instance of this class is assigned to AstarPath.astarData, from it you can access all graphs loaded through the graphs variable. This class also handles a lot of the high level serialization.
